Ts is so tru ong

Anyways i was studying and something obv to anyone studying cs would be that when we delete smth it doesnt aktually get deleted even after clearing bin cause the bits until occupied by smth else are still there for this tools do exist
Like shred on linux

But nothing on mac cause i mean i asked claude adn apparently there existed one but now there is no need as teh data is encrypted and once key is deleted no way to access that data not only that you could enable altho it should already be System Settings → Privacy & Security → FileVault
Also you cant aktually build this cause macs all use SSDs with wear leveling, so overwriting doesn't guarantee the data is actually erased from the physical flash cells
Oh also ts is the reason that your shred command is good in theory but wont work aktuallly in practice so yeah have fun :D

Hey who wants to train models ;D   hmmmm 🤔
Anyways if you wanna start the first thing to know are these
1. FORWARD PASS │ │ Input → Model → Prediction
2. COMPUTE LOSS │ │ How wrong is the prediction?
3. BACKWARD PASS (Backpropagation) │ │ Compute gradients: ∂Loss/∂weights
4. UPDATE WEIGHTS │ │ weights -= learning_rate × gradient
5. REPEAT (thousands of times)
each run tthrough all of data is called an epoch
